data: “Yes! I’m not mistaken at all! _It’s the same woman!_” whispered the tall, good-looking young Englishman in a well-cut navy suit as he stood with his friend, a man some ten years older than himself, at one of the roulette tables at Monte Carlo, the first on the right on entering the room—that one known to habitual gamblers as “The Suicide’s Table.”
browsing: crime/mystery|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: crime, thrillers and mystery|category: novels
